subject: Re: Can you use junit to monitor stock?
msgSnippet: ... Possible: yes. Best approach: no. You can easily write a standalone Java program to do that.  Why would you want to bring any JUnit s overhead into it? I
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Cheng" <wjcheng@...> wrote:
>
> Can you use junit to monitor stock? Someone told me that he used
> Junit to monitor a stock called BVSN and that alert him on the price
> up. Is it possible? Or is it just a joke? Any comment are
> appreciated, and if you know how to technically, I would like to hear.
>
> Cheng
>

Possible: yes.
Best approach: no.

You can easily write a standalone Java program to do that. Why would
you want to bring any JUnit's overhead into it?

I would probably use JUnit to make sure that my program works though.
I would not want to miss any opportunities on BVSN stock :-).

Alberto

http://www.junitfactory.com
Send it Java. Get back JUnit
characterization tests. Free.
